item.title: The Economist Blames Trump For Europe’s Weakness, But Europe Should Blame Itself
item.description: The Economist says President Donald Trump poses a "threat" to Europe. But instead of blaming Trump, Europe should look in the mirror.

item.title: Trump Calls Out Maine Governor For Refusing To Protect Women
item.description: When Democrat Gov. Mills fails to come to the aid of other women, her accomplishments in the name of womanhood are meaningless.

item.title: The 2026 Senate Map Begins to Take Shape
item.description: Senate Republicans are likely to be more on defense than offense in 2026, but the field will be small unless and until the environment deteriorates.

item.title: In Ukraine Interview, Rubio Gives Master Class In Handling Foreign Affairs
item.description: Marco Rubio outlined American interests in the administration's pressure campaign to force friendly a peace deal on Ukraine.

item.title: As Governor, Deb Haaland Would Double Down on New Mexico’s Failures
item.description: What would a Haaland governorship mean for New Mexico? Simply put, it would be a disaster.

item.description: Judge Dale Ho has adopted the Michael Flynn model in navigating this case. I am wary.

item.title: Trump nominates Air Force Lt. Gen. Dan 'Razin' Caine for Joint Chiefs of Staff chairman
item.description: President Donald Trump on Friday nominated Air Force Lt. Gen. Dan 'Razin' Caine for Joint Chiefs of Staff chairman.

item.title: How Elon Musk’s Service to Trump Will Probably, Eventually End
item.description: Elon Musk should take note: Whom the gods wish to destroy, they first make mad with self-regard.

item.title: The Problem with Trump’s IVF Push
item.description: We should be wary of throwing tax dollars at an industry that commodifies babies and bodies and is rife with risk.
